_emerg_resp.FR_OtherRegulation: Department of Agriculture, Lousiania Dept of Public Safety and Corrections (Liquidfied Petroleum Gas Commission)

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

Simplot Grower Solutions 
3714 Old Spanish Trail
New Iberia, LA 70563

Policies and Guidelines: 

It is the policy of the J.R. Simplot Company (Policy Statement EN 01.1) to manufacture, handle, store and dispose of all substances safely and in compliance with the requirements of federal, state and local environmental laws while reducing the risks to human health, safety and the environment.  Each Manager\Supervisor is expected to responsibly implement this policy, and each employee is expected to comply fully with the spirit, as well as the letter of this policy.  The Company will assure that the environmental, health and safety laws, regulations, and standards applicable to its products and operations are known and obeyed by employees. 

The J.R. Simplot Company Safety and Health Policy (Policy Statement SA 001) states that the Company is committed to reducing incidents or occurrences in the workplace that result in human injury, illness, or death, and/or destruction or loss to the corporation's assets and to be in compliance with all laws and regulations governing workplace safety.  It is, therefore, our intent to provide a safe work environment and to protect the corporation's assets. This guideline applies to all groups and separate operating entities of the J.R. Simplot Company.  Emergency plans shall be developed for each operating unit outlining the practices and procedures for emergency medical care, fire response, evacuation, or other emergencies.  Each group shall develop and implement appropriate programs for initial and ongoing safety and loss prevention training of employees. 

Regulated Substance(s): 

At this J.R. Simplot Company retail agriculture fertilizer location, the facility stores and mixes anhydrous ammonia in custom fertilizer blends and with water to created custom aqueous ammonia batches per order. These blends are created per batch, not to exceed a truckload and loaded directly onto the truck for delivery to the custome

r.  Occasionally, (approximately once every 2 years)  a contractor comes on-site to create a non-hazardous fertilizer with the analysis 10-34-0 or 11-37-0. The contractor brings a mobile reactor and uses ammonia from our storage tank to react with acid and the new fertilizer product into a storage onsite for future use in custom blends. The contractor's RMP/PSM prevention plan and documents, as well as safety policies, are provided to the facility for review prior to coming onsite to confirm they are up to date.

Accidental Release Program: 

This Anhydrous ammonia facility implemented the provisions and requirements of the State of Louisiana for storage and handling of anhydrous ammonia and the " Requirements for the Storage and Handling of Ammonia " as published by American National Standards Institute and Compressed Gas Association (ANSI/CGA G-2.1), and the standards of the U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), 29 CFR 1910.111, "Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia". 

Five Year Accident History: 

In the past five years there have been no accidental releases at this site. 

Emergency Response Program: 

This facility is a non-responding facility and an emergency action plan has been developed and put in place for ensure employee safety, rather than a full-fledged response plan. Included in this plan are notification procedures to local responders. Coordination activities with the LEPC and local responders are conducted to ensure this facility is included in the community response plans for an uncontrolled release of anhydrous ammonia. This facility provides any requested information to the LEPC and local responders necessary for developing a strategy for response and mitigating the threat posed by an uncontrolled release of anhydrous ammonia. 

Planned Changes to Improve Safety: 

Safety and Environmental programs are very dynamic, since this is an ongoing process, changes toward improvement are evaluated and implemented periodically. T
he need for improvement is identified by facility employee inputs, inspections and audits which are performed regularly at this facility.
